Object Redis


Redis database client object


To create and manage Redis database, create method:


1
2
var db = require("db");
var test = new db.openRedis("redis-server");



inheritance relationship





Member properties


onsuberror


Function, query and set the error handling function, call back when the sub has an error or the network is interrupted, when the callback occurs, all subs of this object will be terminated


1
Function Redis.onsuberror;



member function


command


Redis basic command method


1
2
Value Redis.command(String cmd,
    ...args);



Call parameters:


    

  • cmd: String, specifies the command to send
    • 

  • args: ..., specify the parameters to send
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Value, returns the result returned by the server
    • 





set


Associate the string value value to the key, if the key already holds another value, SET will overwrite the old value, regardless of the type


1
2
3
Redis.set(Buffer key,
    Buffer value,
    Long ttl = 0);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to associate
    • 

  • value:Buffer, specifying the data to be associated
    • 

  • ttl: Long, set the time-to-live for the key in milliseconds; if ttl is 0, then no time-to-live is set
    • 





setNX


Set the value of key to value if and only if key does not exist. If the given key already exists, SETNX does nothing.


1
2
3
Redis.setNX(Buffer key,
    Buffer value,
    Long ttl = 0);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to associate
    • 

  • value:Buffer, specifying the data to be associated
    • 

  • ttl: Long, set the time-to-live for the key in milliseconds; if ttl is 0, then no time-to-live is set
    • 





setXX


Set the value of key to value, and set the key only when the key already exists.


1
2
3
Redis.setXX(Buffer key,
    Buffer value,
    Long ttl = 0);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to associate
    • 

  • value:Buffer, specifying the data to be associated
    • 

  • ttl: Long, set the time-to-live for the key in milliseconds; if ttl is 0, then no time-to-live is set
    • 





mset


Set one or more key-value pairs at the same time. If a given key already exists, MSET will overwrite the old value with the new value


1
Redis.mset(Object kvs);



Call parameters:


    

  • kvs: Object, specifies the key/value object to set
    • 





Set one or more key-value pairs at the same time. If a given key already exists, MSET will overwrite the old value with the new value


1
Redis.mset(...kvs);



Call parameters:


    

  • kvs: ..., specifies a list of keys/values ​​to set
    • 





msetNX


Simultaneously set one or more key-value pairs if and only if none of the given keys exist


1
Redis.msetNX(Object kvs);



Call parameters:


    

  • kvs: Object, specifies the key/value object to set
    • 





Simultaneously set one or more key-value pairs if and only if none of the given keys exist


1
Redis.msetNX(...kvs);



Call parameters:


    

  • kvs: ..., specifies a list of keys/values ​​to set
    • 





append


If key already exists and is a string, the append command appends value to the end of the original value of key. If key does not exist, append simply sets the given key to value


1
2
Integer Redis.append(Buffer key,
    Buffer value);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specifies the key to append
    • 

  • value:Buffer, specifies the data to append
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Integer, after appending value, the length of the string in key
    • 





setRange


Overwrites the string value stored at the given key with the value parameter, starting at offset offset


1
2
3
Integer Redis.setRange(Buffer key,
    Integer offset,
    Buffer value);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to be modified
    • 

  • offset: Integer, specifies the modified byte offset
    • 

  • value:Buffer, specify the data to overwrite
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Integer, after being modified, the length of the string
    • 





getRange


Returns the substring of the string value in key. The interception range of the string is determined by the two offsets of start and end (including start and end)


1
2
3
Buffer Redis.getRange(Buffer key,
    Integer start,
    Integer end);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to query
    • 

  • start: Integer, specifies the starting byte offset of the query
    • 

  • end: Integer, specifies the end byte offset of the query
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Buffer, to intercept the extracted substring
    • 





strlen


Returns the length of the string value stored at key. Returns an error when the key is not stored as a string value


1
Integer Redis.strlen(Buffer key);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to be calculated
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Integer, the length of the string value. Returns 0 when the key does not exist
    • 





bitcount


Counts the number of bits set to 1 in the given string


1
2
3
Integer Redis.bitcount(Buffer key,
    Integer start = 0,
    Integer end = -1);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to be calculated
    • 

  • start: Integer, specifies the starting byte to calculate, negative values ​​can be used, -1 means the last byte, -2 means the second-to-last byte, and so on
    • 

  • end: Integer, specifies the end byte to calculate, negative values ​​can be used, -1 means the last byte, -2 means the second-to-last byte, and so on
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Integer, the number of bits set to 1
    • 





get


Returns the string value associated with the key, or the special value Null if the key does not exist


1
Buffer Redis.get(Buffer key);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to associate
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Buffer, when the key does not exist, return Null, otherwise, return the value of the key
    • 





mget


Returns all (one or more) values ​​for the given key. If a key does not exist in the given key, then this key returns the special value nil.


1
NArray Redis.mget(Array keys);



Call parameters:


    

  • keys: Array, specifies the key array to query
    • 



Return result:


    

  • NArray, a list containing all the values ​​for the given key
    • 





Returns all (one or more) values ​​for the given key. If a key does not exist in the given key, then this key returns the special value nil.


1
NArray Redis.mget(...keys);



Call parameters:


    

  • keys: ..., specifies a list of keys to query
    • 



Return result:


    

  • NArray, a list containing all the values ​​for the given key
    • 





getset


Sets the value of the given key to value and returns the old value of the key


1
2
Buffer Redis.getset(Buffer key,
    Buffer value);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to query and modify
    • 

  • value:Buffer, specifies the value to modify
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Buffer, returns the old value for the given key
    • 





decr


Subtract the decrement from the value stored by key


1
2
Long Redis.decr(Buffer key,
    Long num = 1);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to be modified
    • 

  • num: Long, specifies the value to subtract
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Long, after subtracting num, the value of key
    • 





incr


Increment the value stored by key


1
2
Long Redis.incr(Buffer key,
    Long num = 1);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to be modified
    • 

  • num: Long, specifies the value to add
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Long, after adding num, the value of key
    • 





setBit


For the string value stored in key, set or clear the bit at the specified offset (bit)


1
2
3
Integer Redis.setBit(Buffer key,
    Integer offset,
    Integer value);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to be modified
    • 

  • offset: Integer, specifies the modified bit offset
    • 

  • value: Integer, specifies the parameter to set or clear, it can be 0 or 1
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Integer, specifies the bit where the offset was originally stored
    • 





getBit


For the string value stored in key, get the bit at the specified offset (bit)


1
2
Integer Redis.getBit(Buffer key,
    Integer offset);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to query
    • 

  • offset: Integer, specifies the bit offset of the query
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Integer, the string value specifies the bit at the offset
    • 





exists


Check if a given key exists


1
Boolean Redis.exists(Buffer key);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to associate
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Boolean, returns True if key exists, otherwise returns False
    • 





type


Returns the type of the value stored by key


1
String Redis.type(Buffer key);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to query
    • 



Return result:


    

  • String, returns the type of the value stored by key, the possible value is none (key does not exist) string (string) list (list) set (collection) zset (ordered set)hash(hash table)
    • 





keys


Find all keys matching the given pattern pattern


1
NArray Redis.keys(String pattern);



Call parameters:


    

  • pattern: String, specifies the query mode
    • 



Return result:


    

  • NArray, a list of keys matching the given pattern
    • 





del


Delete the given key or keys, non-existing keys will be ignored


1
Integer Redis.del(Array keys);



Call parameters:


    

  • keys: Array, specifies the key array to delete
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Integer, the number of deleted keys
    • 





Delete the given key or keys, non-existing keys will be ignored


1
Integer Redis.del(...keys);



Call parameters:


    

  • keys: ..., specifies a list of keys to delete
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Integer, the number of deleted keys
    • 





expire


Set the time-to-live for a given key, when the key expires, it will be automatically deleted


1
2
Boolean Redis.expire(Buffer key,
    Long ttl);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to be set
    • 

  • ttl: Long, set the time-to-live for the key in milliseconds
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Boolean, returns True if key exists, otherwise returns False
    • 





ttl


Returns the remaining time to live for the given key


1
Long Redis.ttl(Buffer key);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to query
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Long, in milliseconds, returns the remaining lifetime of the key, when the key does not exist, it returns -2, when the key exists but the remaining lifetime is not set, it returns -1
    • 





persist


Removes the time-to-live for a given key, converting the key from "volatile" (a key with a time-to-live) to "durable" (a key without a time-to-live that never expires)


1
Boolean Redis.persist(Buffer key);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to be set
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Boolean, returns True if key exists, otherwise returns False
    • 





rename


Rename the key to newkey, and return an error when the key and newkey are the same, or the key does not exist


1
2
Redis.rename(Buffer key,
    Buffer newkey);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to be renamed
    • 

  • newkey:Buffer, specify the destination key to be renamed
    • 





renameNX


If and only if newkey does not exist, rename key to newkey, if key does not exist, return an error


1
2
Boolean Redis.renameNX(Buffer key,
    Buffer newkey);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to be renamed
    • 

  • newkey:Buffer, specify the destination key to be renamed
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Boolean, When the modification is successful, return True, if newkey already exists, return False
    • 





sub


Subscribe to the information of a given channel, and automatically call func when a message occurs. func contains two parameters, which are channel and message in turn. The same function in the same channel will only be called back once


1
2
Redis.sub(Buffer channel,
    Function func);



Call parameters:


    

  • channel:Buffer, specify the channel name to subscribe to
    • 

  • func: Function, specifies the callback function
    • 





Subscribe to the information of a given set of channels, and automatically call the corresponding callback function when the message occurs, the same function of the same channel will only be called back once


1
Redis.sub(Object map);



Call parameters:


    

  • map: Object, specify the channel mapping relationship, the object property name will be used as the channel name, and the property value will be used as the callback function
    • 





unsub


All callbacks to unsubscribe from a given channel


1
Redis.unsub(Buffer channel);



Call parameters:


    

  • channel:Buffer, specify the channel name to unsubscribe from
    • 





The specified callback function to unsubscribe from the given channel


1
2
Redis.unsub(Buffer channel,
    Function func);



Call parameters:


    

  • channel:Buffer, specify the channel name to unsubscribe from
    • 

  • func: Function, specifies the callback function for unsubscribe
    • 





All callbacks to unsubscribe from a given set of channels


1
Redis.unsub(Array channels);



Call parameters:


    

  • channels: Array, specify an array of unsubscribed channels
    • 





The specified callback function to unsubscribe from a given set of channels


1
Redis.unsub(Object map);



Call parameters:


    

  • map: Object, specify the channel mapping relationship, the object property name will be used as the channel name, and the property value will be used as the callback function
    • 





psub


Subscribe to the information of a group of channels according to the template, and automatically call func when a message occurs. func contains three parameters, which are channel, message and pattern in turn. The same template and the same function will only be called back once


1
2
Redis.psub(String pattern,
    Function func);



Call parameters:


    

  • pattern: String, specifies the channel template to subscribe to
    • 

  • func: Function, specifies the callback function
    • 





Subscribe to the information of a given set of channel templates. When a message occurs, the corresponding func will be called automatically. The same function of the same channel will only be called back once


1
Redis.psub(Object map);



Call parameters:


    

  • map: Object, specify the channel mapping relationship, the object property name will be used as the channel template, and the property value will be used as the callback function
    • 





unpsub


All callbacks to unsubscribe from a channel for a given template


1
Redis.unpsub(String pattern);



Call parameters:


    

  • pattern: String, specifies the channel template to unsubscribe from
    • 





The specified callback function to unsubscribe from the channel of the given template


1
2
Redis.unpsub(String pattern,
    Function func);



Call parameters:


    

  • pattern: String, specifies the channel template to unsubscribe from
    • 

  • func: Function, specifies the callback function for unsubscribe
    • 





All callbacks to unsubscribe from a set of channels for a given template


1
Redis.unpsub(Array patterns);



Call parameters:


    

  • patterns: Array, specifies an array of channel templates to publish
    • 





The specified callback function for unsubscribing from a channel of a set of templates


1
Redis.unpsub(Object map);



Call parameters:


    

  • map: Object, specify the channel mapping relationship, the object property name will be used as the channel template, and the property value will be used as the callback function
    • 





pub


Send the information message to the specified channel channel


1
2
Integer Redis.pub(Buffer channel,
    Buffer message);



Call parameters:


    

  • channel:Buffer, specify the channel to publish to
    • 

  • message:Buffer, specifies the message to publish
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Integer, the number of clients that received this message
    • 





getHash


Get the Hash object of the specified key. This object is the client containing the specified key. Only when its method is called will the database be operated.


1
RedisHash Redis.getHash(Buffer key);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to get
    • 



Return result:


    

  • RedisHash, returns a Hash object containing the specified key
    • 





getList


Get the List object of the specified key. This object is the client containing the specified key. Only when its method is called will the database be operated.


1
RedisList Redis.getList(Buffer key);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to get
    • 



Return result:


    

  • RedisList, returns a List object containing the specified key
    • 





getSet


Get the Set object of the specified key. This object is the client that contains the specified key. Only when its method is called will the database be operated.


1
RedisSet Redis.getSet(Buffer key);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to get
    • 



Return result:


    

  • RedisSet, returns a Set object containing the specified key
    • 





getSortedSet


Get the SortedSet object of the specified key, this object is the client containing the specified key, and only when its method is called will the database be operated


1
RedisSortedSet Redis.getSortedSet(Buffer key);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specify the key to get
    • 



Return result:


    

  • RedisSortedSet, returns a SortedSet object containing the specified key
    • 





dump


Serialize the given key and return the serialized value, which can be deserialized into a Redis key using the restore command


1
Buffer Redis.dump(Buffer key);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specifies the key to serialize
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Buffer, returns the serialized value, or null if the key does not exist
    • 





restore


Deserialize the given serialized value and associate it with the given key


1
2
3
Redis.restore(Buffer key,
    Buffer data,
    Long ttl = 0);



Call parameters:


    

  • key:Buffer, specifies the key to deserialize
    • 

  • data:Buffer, specifies the data to deserialize
    • 

  • ttl: Long, set the time-to-live for the key in milliseconds; if ttl is 0, then no time-to-live is set
    • 





close


Close the current database connection or transaction


1
Redis.close();





toString


Returns the string representation of the object, generally returns "[Native Object]", the object can be reimplemented according to its own characteristics


1
String Redis.toString();



Return result:


    

  • String, returns the string representation of the object
    • 





toJSON


Returns the JSON format representation of the object, generally returns the set of readable properties defined by the object


1
Value Redis.toJSON(String key = "");



Call parameters:


    

  • key: String, unused
    • 



Return result:


    

  • Value, returns a value containing JSON serializable
    •
